perturbation.original_text: 4.1 PC Financial shall pay a monthly Fee to Mobimagic in accordance with this Agreement and within the timeline as permitted under the prevailing India regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 PC Financial shall pay a monthly Fee to Mobimagic in accordance with this Agreement and within the timeline as permitted under the prevailing India regulations. Notwithstanding the above, all payments exceeding $100,000 USD shall be subject to a 90-day payment term.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding payment timelines. The original clause states payment should be within the timeline permitted under prevailing Indian regulations, while the modified clause adds a condition that payments exceeding $100,000 USD are subject to a 90-day term. This is inconsistent with the general payment term, creating ambiguity about which term applies.

perturbation.original_text: 6.1 Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. PC Financial shall pay to Mobimagic a fixed service fee in the amount of 970,000 United States Dollars (USD 970,000) for each month (the "Fee") within the timeline as permitted under the prevailing India regulations. It is stipulated in this Agreement that Mobimagic will send an invoice to PC Financial on monthly basis according to the progress of the service. After PC Financial confirms that invoice contents are correct, PC Financial shall pay within 45 days after confirming thus.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. PC Financial shall pay to Mobimagic a fixed service fee in the amount of 970,000 United States Dollars (USD 970,000) for each month (the "Fee") within the timeline as permitted under the prevailing India regulations. perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the payment deadline. Originally, payment was to be made 'within 45 days after confirming' the invoice. perturbation.changed_text: 9.2 This Agreement may be terminated by either Party prior to the end of the Service Period if the other Party is in material breach of any tem, or condition of this Agreement and such breach la not remedied for a period of forty-five (45) days after the Party in breach has been notified In writing of such breach by the other Party.
perturbation.explanation: The clause modifies the cure period for a material breach. Initially, a breach needed to be remedied within thirty (30) days to avoid termination. The modified version extends this period to forty-five (45) days, creating inconsistency about the allowed timeframe to cure a breach and potential disputes over valid termination.
